TopicTitle: A small thing to make asteroids a little more interesting.

Articles.Content:
A asteroid, for the game, is a part.

Crafts are a bunch of parts together.

So multiple asteroid parts in one asteroid craft is also a possibility. If the game would spawn such crafts in addition to the single-part-asteroids, you could encounter this in a stock game. Also, asteroids could be broken up, since it is multiple parts.

I can't be sure, but it seems like what OP was suggesting is the game automatically fusing multiple asteroids together to create uniquely-shaped ones. In the case of making them resemble the Rosetta comet, it almost sounds like what is being referred to is something akin to nurbs or metaballs, as they were referred to among CGI artists (dunno if they still are or not). That seems like a ridiculous amount of extra work for something that can be achieved with a model editor in just a few minutes.

Beyond that... do we have geo-modding? The wiki claims procedural craters is 'partially implemented' but the dev post it cited points to a dead link. I'm not sure if that included collisions producing new craters though. IF such a thing happens, then it seems logical that we could do the same thing to asteroids.
Do you mean Rubble Piles?
